articles.author: Tom Dreisbach
articles.description: NPR investigates allegations that former Los Angeles mayor and current U.S. Ambassador to India Eric Garcetti lied under oath to protect a friend and adviser from harassment claims.
articles.title: Garcetti denies lying under oath to cover up allegations against a top adviser

articles.author: Jennifer Ludden
articles.description: The lawsuit says RealPage’s algorithmic pricing software lets landlords effectively collude and set rents above market rate. The Texas-based company has denied the allegations.
articles.title: DOJ accuses real estate software company of helping landlords collude to raise rents

articles.author: Alina Selyukh
articles.description: The two discount retailers have been battling it out in court for months, accusing each other of intimidation, theft and fraud. Both ship much of their items directly from China
articles.title: The giant of fast fashion Shein is suing its ultracheap rival Temu

articles.author: Elissa Nadworny
articles.description: Abortion rights advocates and providers are suing Alabama Attorney General Steve Marshall, seeking to block him from prosecuting people who help patients travel outside the state to end pregnancies.
articles.title: Can Alabama prosecute someone for helping people travel out of state for an abortion?

articles.author: Josie Lenora
articles.description: An Arkansas court blocked an effort to let voters decide on whether the state should legalize abortion - meaning the state's ban remains in place.
articles.title: An Arkansas court blocks abortion vote

articles.author: Bobby Allyn
articles.description: The fate of TikTok in the U.S. will be determined by a high-stakes court hearing set for September. But TikTok is demanding the government turn over its classified documents on the app.
articles.title: Court to decide who can see secret evidence U.S. has filed against TikTok

articles.author: Hansi Lo Wang
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court has for now granted a Republican request to require Arizona voters to submit proof of their U.S. citizenship when using the state’s registration form.
articles.title: Supreme Court grants GOP bid to require citizenship proof for some Arizona voters

articles.author: Sarah Wyman
articles.description:
The Third Amendment. Maybe you've heard it as part of a punchline. It's the one about quartering troops — two words you probably haven't heard side by side since about the late 1700s.
At first glance, it might not seem super relevant to modern life. But in fact, the U.S. government has gotten away with violating the Third Amendment several times since its ratification — and every time it's gone largely unnoticed.
Today on Throughline's We the People: In a time of escalating political violence, police forces armed with military equipment, and more frequent and devastating natural disasters, why the Third Amendment deserves a closer look.
articles.title: We The People: Canary in the Coal Mine

articles.author: Hosts
articles.description: The Walt Disney Company has reversed its decision to toss a wrongful death suit over a Disney+ agreement.
articles.title: Disney reverses wrongful death decision

articles.author: Dave Davies
articles.description: NBC Newsinvestigative reporter David Rohde says that since 2016, Trump has used conspiracy theories, co-option and threats to undermine federal law enforcement. His new book is Where Tyranny Begins.
articles.title: How Trump bent the Justice Department and FBI to his will
